abstract: World Health Organization advises pregnant women to avoid travel to areas where Zika virus has taken hold and to practice safe sex or abstinence if they have been to affected areas; stops short of advising women to delay pregnancy but recommends ready access to contraception.

headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Strengthens Warnings on Zika Virus
headline.main: W.H.O. Advises Pregnant Women to Avoid Areas Where Zika Is Spreading

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The committee said that they were not recommending that pregnant women avoid whole countries, but that they avoid only “areas” where mosquitoes are transmitting the virus.
lead_paragraph: The committee said that they were not recommending that pregnant women avoid whole countries, but that they avoid only “areas” where mosquitoes are transmitting the virus.
